noun.description: A small, white-toothed whale related to the narwhal, living in herds mainly in Arctic coastal waters.
A very large sturgeon occurring in the inland seas and associated rivers of central Eurasia.

origin: Late 16th century (in beluga (sense 2)): from Russian belukha ( beluga (sense 1)), beluga ( beluga (sense 2)), both from belyĭ white.
